etymons.meaning: to inflict pain; to suffer pain; cf. MEA kwb SL 602: to be in pain

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: 1) lo=kayudukṯo m-diḏi 583; 7/18; aḏnikayiwoḥzele, faydalayt! b-i=ḥaraytohəngi d-kayiwo i=lašayḏe, u=admofayəšnoḥət me-kulgabo me-diḏe, qayəm
translations: ‘He saw that there was nothing to do. Finally, because his body was hurting and because he was bleeding from all sides, he got up’ 77/83;

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: 2) kayu-le l-u=paša 584; prs 62/34; prs 63/29; 26/5; u=ḥa=yawmo, i=sawt-aṯe, kayu-la, w húla-lxuʕomro 2/69; am=mədhoyedə-mǧahadde, kayəwwe b-u=med-anoMidən; (оченьнеобычноеупотребление. Может, в идиомы?)

translations: ‘Something has come to my mind. (Once) a certain gypsy came to us. And I was ill at that time. And

Infectum.turoyo: 1) u=kew-awo ko-koyu 583; 70/10; ádyawmariši ko-koyu. duʕrina l-u=bayto!
translations: ‘Today I have a headache, let us return home!’; 43/44

Infectum.turoyo: 2) g-doʕeno l-alo d-kŭyaw-le l-babəx 584; prs 62/34; bas, d-lo=šuġlikayso, kŭyaw-le ; 3/74; i=naqqa d-ko-koyaw-we l-nošemede-ste, d-k-owe u=dŭrum i=waḏ̣ʕiyaṯṯenaxwaš, ko-saymənneqandelo, w ko-məšḥi u=ʕamo 584; 94/53;
g-huǧmiaṭ=Ṭaye w-i=ʕaskariyeaʕlayxu w-gə-məšqolo i=qriṯo. w-aḥna ko-koyaw-lanabxu

Part act..turoyo: u=qəsəm d-lawġul d-owe kayiwo w saqaṭ, lo=k-məšməʕ aw k-yuqro i=aḏno 584; 3/44; 11/259, 274; 26/10; 30/46; 49/13; 78/203;

Infinitiv.turoyo: ono hawi b-qarʕimedoneġắlabe, w ono k-oḏaʕno u=kyowayḏux 584; 83/16;

Preterit.turoyo: 1) ham ko-bəxyo, w ham ko-maqaḏḥo i=nurayḏa, afandəmhəngi d-makulaleba b-u=baxyo585; 65/277; oḏáʕ-way-no lo=makiwoli, amma i=kačkenafilo 3) makule b-ruḥe 585; 112/152; (примеротсутствует в указанномместе)

Infectum.turoyo: 1) i=ḥurm-aṯe, lə=nafiqoṭawtoʕam an=naʕim-ani d-kət-ne gabe. kulyawmo k-oṯeʕaṣriye l-u=bayto, k-əmmo-le: “i=barṯayḏux w u=abrayḏux, mballeməxdiḏi, w ko-makiwiqarʕi, w lə=ko-šəmʕi mini, u=mede d-əmman-ne lə=k-maṣiṯiaʕli” ;586; 75/7; gd-əmmi: “arbʕi-hatu, g-makiwuturišan, w-gə-mqatlutuʕam-ḥḏoḏe, man kt-owe malko ‘They (the inhabitants of the kingdom) will say:i=naqla d-k-əbʕimoḥən l-noše w-makəwən-ne ko-moḥən b-ar=rawṭe d-ar=remune 2) əmmihano, u=rabo, əmmi g-makugawemene, məlle: ya u=aḥunayḏi, bas sayməthawxabayzət u=medayḏan w əzzúx l-u=ṣaydo, kulyawmoməblətarbʕi=greʕeaʕmux, ḥamši=greʕeaʕmux, bayzət u=malayḏan 585-586; 98/4;
translations: “There are four of you, and you will cause us a headache, you will fight with each other: who will become the king” 73/8;
‘When someone wants to hit a person and inflict pain on him, he hits (him) with pomegranate rods’ 77/78;
